clips.description: High-tension moment where the presenter discovers a URL that decodes to a malicious script and lists exactly what an attacker could take (bank info, crypto wallets, private chats). Immediate hook and clear stakes — perfect for short-form attention.

editings.reason: Hook in first 3s ('holy s**t' / look what cursor found). Contains discovery, explanation of malicious behavior, and concrete consequences — self-contained arc showing risk.
editings.title: Shocking malware in interview code — what it steals

clips.title: Shocking malware in interview code — what it steals

clips.description: Practical, actionable rundown of red flags (no contact links, gibberish sites, time pressure to run code locally) that help viewers quickly assess suspicious recruiting offers. Strong utility for job-seekers.

editings.reason: Direct advice sequence listing concrete red flags and what to check (websites, contact links, pressure to run code) — standalone checklist viewers can act on.
editings.title: 5 red flags in remote coding interviews — avoid scams

clips.title: 5 red flags in remote coding interviews — avoid scams

clips.description: Actual clipped portion of the leaked interview showing the recruiter pressuring the candidate to run 'npm start', odd recruitment questions and geographical/travel demands. Real-world example that highlights the earlier advice.

editings.reason: Starts with 'here is the leaked interview' (strong hook). Contains a clear beginning (intro), middle (requests to run code / odd questions), and end (candidate confusion) — makes the danger tangible.
editings.title: Leaked recruiter interview — red flags you must see

clips.title: Leaked recruiter interview — red flags you must see

clips.description: Explains the limits of AI/code-scanning agents: they don't 'think', follow rules blindly, can ignore safety rules, and can produce false negatives. Valuable cautionary context for relying solely on automated tools.

editings.reason: Clear, standalone explanation of AI agent behavior and pitfalls with examples from the story. Educates viewers why automated scans aren't a guarantee of safety.
editings.title: Why AI agents can miss malware — a dangerous blindspot

clips.title: Why AI agents can miss malware — a dangerous blindspot
